keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

headline.print_headline: A Rift Emerges in Efforts to Quell Terrorism in South Asia
headline.main: Bangladesh Pushes Back as Warnings of ISIS Expansion Gather Steam

byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik contributed reporting from Dhaka, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

snippet: The disconnect between the country and foreign intelligence agencies could complicate efforts to prevent the spread of global terrorism in South Asia.
abstract: Government of Bangladeshi Prime Min Sheikh Hasina has steadfastly insisted string of attacks within country for which Islamic State group has claimed responsibility were work of internal opposition leaders, despite warnings from American officials that terrorists linked to ISIS were planning attacks; disconnect between Bangladeshi and international authorities could affect efforts to combat terrorism in South Asia.
lead_paragraph: The disconnect between the country and foreign intelligence agencies could complicate efforts to prevent the spread of global terrorism in South Asia.
